alert.note: Alert for Salem (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 10:23PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of New Castle, northwestern Kent, northeastern Kent and west central Salem Counties through 1100 PM EDT... At 1022 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Warwick, or near Middletown, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wilmington, Newark, Middletown, Pennsville, Carneys Point, Elsmere, New Castle, Salem, Clayton, Delaware City, Newport, Stanton, North Star, Glasgow, Bear, Port Penn, Wilmington Manor, Delaney Corner, Pike Creek and Saint Georges. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 0 and 13. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
